## ğŸ› Found a Bug?

If you've found a bug, please:

1. **Search existing issues** to see if it's already reported
2. **Create a bug report** using our [bug report template](https://github.com/Refactron-ai/Refactron_Website/issues/new?template=bug_report.yml)
3. Include:
   - Clear description of the issue
   - Steps to reproduce
   - Expected vs actual behavior
   - Screenshots (if applicable)
   - Your environment (browser, OS, Node.js version)

## ğŸ’¡ Have a Feature Request?

We love hearing your ideas! To suggest a new feature:

1. **Search existing feature requests** to avoid duplicates
2. **Create a feature request** using our [feature request template](https://github.com/Refactron-ai/Refactron_Website/issues/new?template=feature_request.yml)
3. Explain:
   - The problem it solves
   - Your proposed solution
   - Why it would be useful to others

## â“ Questions & Discussions

For general questions, discussions, or ideas:

- **[GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/Refactron-ai/Refactron_Website/discussions)** - Ask questions and discuss with the community
- **[Issues](https://github.com/Refactron-ai/Refactron_Website/issues)** - For specific problems or feature requests only

## ğŸ“§ Contact

## ğŸ”’ Security Issues

**Please do not report security vulnerabilities through public GitHub issues.**

Instead, please report them via email to **hello@refactron.ai**

See our [Security Policy](../SECURITY.md) for more details.

## ğŸ’¬ Community Guidelines

When seeking support:

- âœ… Be respectful and patient
- âœ… Provide detailed information
- âœ… Search before asking
- âœ… Follow up on your questions
- âŒ Don't bump issues repeatedly

## â±ï¸ Response Times

We aim to respond to:

- **Security issues:** Within 48 hours
- **Bug reports:** Within 3-5 business days
- **Feature requests:** Within 1 week
- **General questions:** Within 1 week

Please note that this is an open source project maintained by volunteers, so response times may vary.

## ğŸ¯ Getting Help with Development

If you're contributing and need help:

1. **Read the documentation** - Most answers are in our guides
2. **Check the code** - Look at existing implementations
3. **Ask in discussions** - The community can help
4. **Comment on your PR** - Ask specific questions
5. **Be patient** - Maintainers will review when available
